com.RecSys.Recommender

Class ProcessData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.RecSys.Recommender.ProcessData

  • public class ProcessData
extends java.lang.Object
    This class preprocesses the data of the competition. There are methods to reduce the initial dataset, to aggregate values or to sort or merge files. Many of the operations could also be done in other programming languages or by using databases.

    • Method Detail

      • reduceDataset

        public static java.lang.String reduceDataset(int interval)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates a dataset that contains every xth session of the original clicks dataset.
        Parameters:
        interval - determines in which interval a session should be kept in the file
        Returns:
        the path of the reduced file
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • aggregateBuys

        public static void aggregateBuys(java.lang.String buyFileName,
                                 java.lang.String aggregatedFileName)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        This method aggregates all records of the buys file that contain the same session id and same product id. Several buys of the same user on the same product are summed up. This is why the timestamp is left out in the result
        Parameters:
        buyFileName - The path of the buys file that should be aggregated
        aggregatedFileName - The path of the file that should be created
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • normalizeImplicitRecScore

        public static void normalizeImplicitRecScore(java.lang.String outputRecFile)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
        This method normalizes the preference values of the SVD recommender's output. Values are normalized to a value between 0 and 5
        Parameters:
        outputRecFile - Path of the file that contains the recommendations of the SVD recommender
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • aggregateClicks

        public static void aggregateClicks(java.lang.String clickFileName,
                                   java.lang.String aggregatedFileName)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        This method aggregates the clicks with same session id and same product id. Several clicks of the same user on the same product are summed up. This is why the timestamp is left out in the result
        Parameters:
        clickFileName - Path of the clicks file that should be aggregated
        aggregatedFileName - Path of the buys file that should be created
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • sortFile

        public static java.lang.String sortFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                                        boolean desc,
                                        int innerArrayPosition,
                                        java.lang.String separator)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Sorts the files
        Parameters:
        fileName - Path of the file to be sorted
        innerArrayPosition - The position of the column in the file which should be sorted with 2. priority (0 means 1. Column)
        desc - True if inner sorting should be descending, false if inner sorting should be ascending
        separator - (either "," or ";")
        Returns:
        Path of the sorted file
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        public static java.lang.String[][] ConvertFileTo2dArray(java.lang.String filePath,
                                                        java.lang.String separator)
                                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Converts a file to a 2d array to be able to sort it
        Parameters:
        filePath - Path of file
        separator - Which separator? Either "," or ";"
        Returns:
        A 2d String array
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • sort2dArray

        public static java.lang.String[][] sort2dArray(java.lang.String[][] file,
                                               boolean desc,
                                               int innerArrayPosition)
        Sort the 2d array
        Parameters:
        file - Path of the file
        desc - True if Descending order
        innerArrayPosition - The position of the column in the file which should be sorted with 2. priority (0 means 1. Column)
        Returns:
        A sorted string array

                                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Print the sorted array to a file
        Parameters:

      • convertToRatings

        public static java.lang.String convertToRatings(java.lang.String mergedFileName)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Method prints a file with ratings. Can be combined with different algorithms in class RatingAlgorithm.java
        Parameters:
        mergedFileName - Path of the merged file (clicks and buys merged, structure: sessionid, productid, category, numberClicks, price, numberBuys)
        Returns:
        Path of the ratings file
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • convertToRatingsStudyByChoiEtAl

        public static java.lang.String convertToRatingsStudyByChoiEtAl(java.lang.String mergedFileName)
                                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        This method creates a files with implicit ratings. it follows the approach by Chio et al. Modification of the approach by Choi et al: Also clicks will be regarded.
        Parameters:
        mergedFileName - Path of merged file
        Returns:
        Path of rated file
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getTotalClicksAndBuysForEachSession

        public static int[][] getTotalClicksAndBuysForEachSession(java.lang.String mergedFileName)
                                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • joinDatasets

        public static void joinDatasets(java.lang.String clickFileName,
                                java.lang.String buyFileName,
                                java.lang.String mergedFileName)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        This method joins a clicks file and a buys file. Both files have to be aggregated. Join happens on productID and sessionID.
        Parameters:
        clickFileName - path of the aggregated clicks file
        buyFileName - path of the aggregated buys file
        mergedFileName - path of the merged file to be created
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • joinDatasetsBuysWithoutCorrespondingProductID

        public static void joinDatasetsBuysWithoutCorrespondingProductID(java.lang.String clickFileName,
                                                                 java.lang.String buyFileName,
                                                                 java.lang.String mergedFileName)
                                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        This method prints all records that correspond to a session in the clicks file but which contain a product id that did not appear in the clicks file EDIT: Output File is always empty because there are no buys of products that have not been clicked on
        Parameters:
        clickFileName - Path of clicks file
        buyFileName - Path of buys file
        mergedFileName - Path of merged File
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
